Reviews.Title: “Great place if you're on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: Emily S
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights at Hotel Villa in Montreal. I went with my boyfriend, and both being university students, we were on a very tight budget. I was a little nervous about bedbugs, the cleanliness, and the neighbourhood because of reviews that I read before going. However, the room was very clean, there were no bedbugs, and I had no problems with the neighbourhood. We got a standard room, which included a bathroom, which was very nice and clean. It came with towels and soap and whatnot. The only thing I was slightly disappointed in was that the hotel room description said there would be an iron, a hairdryer, a mini-fridge, etc. and it had none of those things. I think they were available upon request though. The breakfast cafe on the main floor of the hotel was delightful. The food was amazing, fast service, and inexpensive. The hotel staff were very friendly and accommodating to all of our needs. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who is on a tight budget and doesn't mind an older room. I know I'll be back if I'm in the area again!

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: borborhick
Reviews.Content: I was in Montreal for 9 days on business with a very tight budget and chose this hotel based solely on price, but I'll be back! The staff is friendly and helpful, the rooms are nothing special but seriously, with such a low price you really shouldn't expect a high end room My room had a comfortable bed, a TV, my own sink, and a dresser. Hooks on the wall were an added bonus as I laid out work clothes in advance on them. My window was huge enough that I spent most nights sitting in the window sill people watching and just enjoying the night. We had a shared bathroom but there was never an issue with that. It was always clean and available (two per floor). Yes, the neighbourhood is a bit sketchy, but I knew that in advance as I research cities that I stay in. I still, as a solo woman traveller, was comfortable coming back from the Metro (SO close!!) every night after dark and leaving before 7am for work. Try the breakfast in the small kitchen area on the main floor - the people are amazing, the prices are good, and the food was a great start to the day. I think the next time that I'm in Montreal, strict travel budget or not, I'll stay here again and save the money to enjoy the city with.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you paid for!”
Reviews.Author: Angelitonyc
Reviews.Content: The location is great, a lots of homeless people on the street but they are harmless... You can walk everywhere, the room was ok it was old but clean. The share bathroom was clean too but the door look broke the second night!! Again you get what you pay!

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: shahram293999
Reviews.Content: Hi Shahram from Iran I was in the Villa Hotel for nine nights from 10 to 19 Oct 2011. It was clean and everything was refurbished, new items include: floor covering, painting, curtains and matrixes. I was in a two double bed standard room in the second floor. The managers were friendly. The bath room inside was clean and spacious. The hotel location is excellent as it is in the saint Catherine Str., One of the most popular streets in Montreal. If the room was equipped by a coffee maker it would be excellent. I recommend this economical hotel strongly.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bug infestation - disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: thatonegirlhh
Reviews.Content: A couple of friends and I decided to stay at a hotel that was conveniently right beside the metropolis. We had checked the bed before hand for bed bugs and found nothing until we came back later that night and came to find bed bugs all over the bed and curtains. To our disgust, we left the hotel room immediately and went downstairs to issue a refund. (We here not even in the room for more than 2 hours overall). We went downstairs and had found that there were already two men complaining about the bed bug infestation in their hotel room on the 6th floor (we were on the 3rd). We went to the front desk and asked for a refund but the young man working at the counter could not apparently issue it at such a time so we were left stranded with no money and no hotel to stay at. Luckily we found one at the end of the evening that was only $10 dollars more and clean and safe. hotel villa was disgusting and the only solution the front desk had was to give us a crappier room. I advise that no one stays here. (Location is terrible as well) When confronted about the infestation the man at the desk had said they have had many complaints and hotel managers use 'chemical pesticide' rather then getting an exterminator because they claim to not want to spend money.. the next day when we got our refund the other man claimed they called the exterminator within the hours of 4am and 10 am... not possible.. nothing was done.

Reviews.Title: “better off to sleep in your car”
Reviews.Author: HKDGSC
Reviews.Content: would not recommend anyone stay here. bad, unsafe neighborhourhood with drugs, gangs. dirty, musty, smoky smell inside. no swipe cards, give keys, no elevator to 6 floor, had to walk the rest, small cramped room, never heard of this - shared washroom - disgusting. our room wasn't ready even 2.5 hours after check in time, assinged us another room and someone was in there when we got there and they gave us key to room that someone already had. your stuff is not safe. not good sleep, no peace of mind, afraid someone might come into room or steal, break into car at night. bad part of town, no security. recommend spend another $20 and stay somewhere else it will be worth it, you'll feel safe, have peace of mind and not worry about ur safety. not recommended for solo travellers at all.

Reviews.Title: “good location, not so good services”
Reviews.Author: MariaVerano
Reviews.Content: Yes, good location, just a few blocks away from the bus station, from berri uqam metro station and the quartier latin. Room was ok, small, it looked clean, had a tv and a small empty fridge, towels, soap and shampoo. No phone, and I should say no elevator cause I got there in the afternoon and by 9 pm it was broken and the following day it was still broken. Breakfast is not included, but they give it for $2. All and all I would recommend it if you're passing by Montreal and don't want an expensive hotel. Some people say that this neighbourhood is busy and that 'things' happen. I never saw a thing. Also, I didn't come back late at night.

Reviews.Title: “only good for location and price”
Reviews.Author: ashpat08
Reviews.Content: there is no elevator facility for 6 th floor--you have to carry /or drag your luggage from 5th to 6th floor----too many bed bugs---we werre not able to slip for whole night---shower knob was brocken------they do not change the linnen after used by the customer---i paid for the room for the room with attached bathroom and was alloted room without bathroom and bathroom was in corridor----it was really horrible experience i ever had-----i advice to all to pay a little bit more and stay at comfortable hotel---hotel has 2 star---but i give not star take care before going to such places

Reviews.Title: “A Total Dump”
Reviews.Author: Mina13579
Reviews.Content: I have traveled all over 5 continents, but this "hotel" is the absolute worst I have ever seen. The elevator doesn't actually stop level to the floor, the carpets are stained with blood and food, the windows were cracked, and there was a cigarette butt on the bed! I saw two rooms and they were both filthy and disgusting. AVOID THIS PLACE! It was a nightmare! I left because I was so freaked out, and the hotel refused to issue me a refund, even though I didn't stay there!

Reviews.Title: “I'd never go back if they paid me, oh wait they did....”
Reviews.Author: Ameeaimes
Reviews.Content: it was a horrible stay, the man who was working his first day first shift my check out morning when it was early enough after partying that on new years morning i was the only person around (im a girl) he tried to pick me up and he even tried to go down my leggings, they didnt even call the cops when they said they'd have to. I was assured he was fired. They gave me a 50$ cash " happy new years /thanks for staying here" write off i had to sign off on. The manager a chinese woman, even asked me to write a review about the other guy who worked there about how good he was and it over looked this guy. Sorry, my whole trip was ruined.

Reviews.Title: “A sour taste in my mouth”
Reviews.Author: CheapTraveler182187
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three days. This hotel left a sour taste in my mouth. It broke my heart to see my partner with a tear in her eye when she realized this was what we would call home for the remainder of our Montreal outing. In summary the room was small, the bathrooms were dirty, the neighborhood was unsafe, and the price was much too high. It is like living in an old University dorm. Location was mostly poor. Although in downtown, it was on a decaying end of Saint Catherine street. There are sex shops around, which doesn't really bother me, but the hookers across the street, and the drug deals taking place absolutely were. A lot of bad business would go on throughout the night, which resulted in little to no sleep. I would frequently have to trudge through screaming individuals to get to the hotel. The pictures of the rooms on hotel villas website seemed decent enough so I opted for the shared bathroom accommodation. I was unaware that there is only one bathroom per floor. I'm unsure as to how many were using this bathroom, but it was frequently dirty and I decided to not shower during the trip once I notice the garbage can was in the tub. The bathrooms weren't nice and needed renovation work. As for the room itself, an exposed copper pipe dressed the ceiling and ended with scorch marks from an inplace weld. Apparently the owners do not have to time to clean a burned wall up, or at least paint over it. Service was good, we didn't ask for anything demanding or out of the ordinary so I just gave the hotel an average rating. The hotel had a policy of 11pm quiet hours, but those were not enforced. Regardless of price, I would never stay here again. I also would never return to this portion of downtown Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: KATCANUS
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel and found the experience to be very nice. It is affordable and (you need to ask for one) you can have your own bathroom w/ shower. It was $69.00 for one night, which is very affordable. It is in the Red Light District of Monteal (St. Catherine street) so you are going to see your share of various people. Let me tell from first hand experience, no one is waiting outside this hotel with handguns or waving knifes at you. Yes, even at 3am when I returned almost every night. People, listen, there are good parts and bad parts of every city. With nightclubs and strip joints very close to this hotel, what would you expect to find? How ever you answer that is what is probably going to be the case. I will give you younger people some advice, mind your p's and q's (Your own business if you don't get that.) and you will be just fine. If you obnoxious after drinking or like to make comments at people you don't know, then you may just find trouble. So keep your comments to yourself until you are home or safe in yoru hotel room. Seriously, it is a nice hotel, the person working behind the counter (Van) was very nice and we chatted the few days I was there. I would go back in a minute (and Van, I am coming back in the summer.) and it is safe. People, listen up, it is not 1950 and you need to be careful where ever you go. Use your head, stay away from trouble and you will be just fine. However, if you want to be very secure, you can go to a Holiday Inn or Quality Inn (a little further away) and "Lot" more expensive, say to the tune of $200 a night. Now, I don't know about you, but for me, I am not going to pay $200 a night for a hotel I will be in mainly to sleep and shower while vacationing! If you are a single person on a trip or a couple looking to save money, this is the hotel for you. If you want a room with a bathroom and shower, make sure you ask for one when you are making a reservation. I hear people complaining about them not getting this or that when they reserve something and usually it's because they weren't paying attention to what was included with the reservation. Hope you find this useful. P.S. I just want to clarify something. Canadians do not hate Americans. They hate obnoxious people, like Americans do as well. Actually, in the stores and places I went, the staff was friendlier to me there than in my own country. Yeah, that would be the United States! Oh, and if you are traveling by bus, prepare to get off of it at the border, be polite and follow instructions (Have the proper documentation, Passport, Passcard or Enhanced Driver's License. (You need to go to Montpelier if you live in Vermont, and get this. The enhanced license that is. As of June 2009 your old driver's license and birth certificate will not do. Do not be stupid and find this out as you get to the border! ) and you will be just fine. Be rude, and you can expect to not get through or go to one of the rooms they have at the border station made for those kind of people. For the record, the Amercan side, coming back in, is where they can be rude. Be ready for it. Way different than if you are just driving through with your own vehicle. They will actually go through your bags, which is fine, but for me it was the way they did this that bothered me. Totally not called for. Other than that, the trip was great!

Reviews.Title: “Disapointed”
Reviews.Author: erika_23
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel last minute. Being a student, I was looking for convenience and affordability. While this hotel fit both descriptions, I was horrified to realize that I felt neither safe nor comfortable in this hotel. Across the street weas the entire population of street kids and gang members. Three feet from the hotel, my boyfriend witnessed a man pull out 2 crack pipes, and I overheard a drug transaction take place. Not all rooms have a bathroom. We were expected to share a bathroom with 4 other rooms. I met our neighbour before we even had a chance to unpack. He was an overweight, old man, sitting shirtless and looking intoxicated, watching tv with his door open....Needless to say, I would need my boyfriend to stand watch at the bathroom door with a shotgun for me to consider taking a shower there. It seems more like a cheap hotel for pimps to take their business too. Luckily, if you had made your reservation within 24 hours, you could cancel and get your money back, which I did, and we stayed elsewhere. Yes, it cost me quite a bit more, but at least I wasn't fearful for my life.

Reviews.Title: “Only good for the location”
Reviews.Author: Druxilla
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only good for the location. It is a prime location - especially during the jazz festival - at $97/night (shared bathroom) - I thought it was a great find. You are about a 30 second walk to the jazz festival. You can hear it at night, but it wasn't disturbing. The people are nice - they overcharged us but were quick to resolve the problem. Room was OK - if you are a picky person, then forget it. It's clean, but they don't really clean your room - sometimes our beds were made, we got some clean towels. Room is very small, but survivable. There is a sink in the room with soap but no kleenex box. The bathroom was a little gross. Sink was clogged the whole time so we had to come back to our room to wash our hands. I stayed there for 4 nights and the smell in the hallway (a mix of pee and weed) increased every day. Breakfast was basic - good croissants, toast, bananas, coffee. It was fine for my trip, but I would look a other places the next time I go to Montreal - not worth $97, even for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot to visit the city”
Reviews.Author: Amanila
Reviews.Content: Hotel Villa is a perfect place for visiting the city. It is very convenient to get to the old Montreal, Chinatown and shopping malls. The rooms are very cheap and comfortable. Staffs are very nice and helpful. They helped me plan my visit in Montreal. I don't think I would have time and opportunity to visit so many places in so short time if they did not suggested me which places to visit most importantly. Great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best for the Price”
Reviews.Author: Anangaya
Reviews.Content: I stayed for couple of days in the weeked with my family. The new administration is fantastic. Very friendly and very good service. And panaromic view of downtown of Montreal. Easy to access for all services including Metro, Bus and restaurants. Very important thing is near to the old port. Walking distance. Multicultural environment and planty of festivals. Room rates are very good compare to other hotels. Family packages are fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “An beautiful image can be an illusion”
Reviews.Author: martinm22
Reviews.Content: When I saw the information on internet, about this hotel I was very charm ( for 1 star ) .It was looking very great, but my experience tell me an other side of that image. I know It`s a 1 star hotel.So, I knew at the beginning, It was not a super class hotel, but... I had many problems with what they was saying. They said, the hotel has the AC and Continental Breakfeast and also parking.The AC is not able to refresh the room, even if you let it open all of the time.Also, I never saw any muffin or anything like that. To be honnest with you, for the parking, the only thing you have ( has a hotel resident ), It`s you can go away with your car and come back to the parking and you will never be towed, but after your time, you have to pay again.You are suppose to pay at 8 AM.So, forget the grace morning.You have to go out and pay, if you dont want to be towed. An other thing ( I seen reviews who they were telling that ), the security it`s a little to much.I understand they are in downtown area, but they ask too many question about my travel and what I was doiing.Your life, it`s your life, they are not suppose to ask question about that. Also, the toilet take lot`s of time to wash.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: amber80
Reviews.Content: This hotel should advertise as a "by the hour" establishment. In fact, at night, [-----] are positioned on corners around this hotel. It is on a street surrounded by [---] shops and you have to be buzzed into the lobby through a security gate. The room we were shown was dirty (used plastic utensils in a drawer, food crumbs on a table, furniture that hadn't be dusted in God knows how long, and the extra blanket that was provided was filthy- this was after we had to wait to check-in so that the room could be cleaned!). Walking in the room was like going into a slum apartment in NYC, and you are expected to pay upfront-- probably so you feel locked into staying there rather than fight for your money back. Private bathrooms are optional and we chose a room that had one. It looked fairly clean, but the light switch also turns on the fan which sounded like a small plane taking off. The air conditioner that was in the window was 1/2 the size of what it should have been and the open parts of the window were not covered. After telling the person at the front desk that we didn't feel comfortable staying there as it in no way was representative of the rooms that were pictured online, we were shown another room--the hotel's "VIP" suite. The second room was easily twice the size of the first and was somewhat better furnished (although, there was still no phone in the room) and appeared to be clean (I wasn't in there long enough to thoroughly check), but we were expected to walk through a construction site to get to it! I was told that the hotel is in the middle of remodling and that this is their best room that usually goes for over $200 CAN a night. I thought it was ridiculous to have to pass under a worker who was plastering anytime we wanted to get into our room and told the front desk guy as much. I then had to fight with the manager on the phone to get a refund of the money that I had to pay upfront for our stay. I have never been treated so disrespectfully by the manager of a hotel before. He advised me that their 48 hour cancellation policy would not allow him to refund the full price I had paid- he said he would refund all but two days. We didn't cancel! We showed up and the place was completely unacceptable and not at all what was presented on their website. After some more fighting, he refunded all but one day (which I'm currently disputing with my credit card company since we did not cancel, but left because it was disgusting). I can't imagine any age group or type of traveler that would feel comfortable staying there. The website shows a kind of "barebones" place, but it wasn't even as good as that! I wouldn't recommend this for anyone who would be remotely concerned with hygiene or personal safety.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect a lot”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Overall, this hotel is okay at best. There are only two positives, very clean and new bathrooms, and a decent location to crash at night. However, the asthetic appearance and quality is the worst I've experienced. The interior hallways are from an old abandoned building, some rooms are rented out on a fulltime basis to bums, and the hotel is frequently used by prostitutes in the area. Also, there is no a/c or tv. Bathrooms are an option in the room (I strongly suggest you get the room with one, as you do not want to be sharing a hallway bathroom with the people of this area). This hotel is good for younger people who don't care as much about the looks, but be advised that management is very tight about the no visitors policy (they guard the door 24/7). We got into an argument with them because we couldn't bring back friends for the afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Price, location, staff~ great... Building- rooms, hallways~ need work!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a friend at this Hotel for New Years Eve Weekend. Upon arriving, I was shocked to see that the pictures online depicted something very different in my mind. When we were brought to our room, we were a little dissappointed with the appearance. The walls are very plain, and the tv doesnt come in very well. Also, the hallways and stairways had about 5 different types of carpet... it was as if they ran out of the kind they were using half way up the stairs- a new color for every floor. It looked somewhat "ghetto". Although the room wasnt what I had in mind, it was ALWAYS spotless and immaculate- the bathroom especially which is ofcourse a GOOD thing. Never-the-less, my friend and I- being college aged young women, were not there to enjoy the room and the tv. All we needed was a place to crash after hitting the clubs and drinking all night. The location was absolutely SUPERB!! It was right in the middle of all the hottest clubs, bars, and so on- so it was extremely difficult to get lost (even if intoxicated lol) Also, the staff- the owner and his wife (I believe) were extremely pleasant and helpful! The hotel was cheap- considering the nights I stayed (one of the most busy weekends)- $85 a night. I got what I payed for as far as the room goes... but as far as location and staff, I got far and beyond more then what I payed for. A great first timer (in Montreal) experience. Me and my friend will be returing to Montreal this New Year coming up- and will probably give good thought on returning to this establishment.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Villa
HotelInfo.Address: 57 Sainte-Catherine Est, Montreal, Quebec H2X 1K5, Canada
